Based on your preference cues, here are two movie recommendations that fit those preferences:

- Title: White Night (2007) | Plot: A pawnbroker is found murdered in a remote town. Police suspect that he was murdered by an acquaintance, as even the most experienced investigator on the case could identify no signs of resistance. Three people come under suspicion but all of them have perfect alibis and the investigation comes to a standstill. One year later, one of them is found dead and the original murder case becomes even more mysterious. Almost fifteen years pass and the lead inspector, now approaching retirement, reflects on the only case he could not solve in an otherwise successful career. Haunted by a sense of responsibility and guilt that he caused suffering by letting the murder case go unsolved, he decides to re-investigate.

Based on your preference cues, I would recommend the movie "Total Recall". This film stars Arnold Schwarzenegger and is based on a short story by William Shakespeare. The movie follows a factory worker who begins to suspect that he is a spy after visiting Rekall  - a company that provides its clients with implanted fake memories of a life they would like to have led  - goes wrong and he finds himself on the run.
Overall, "Total Recall" is an entertaining and thought-provoking movie. The film's concept of implanting fake memories in people's minds is both fascinating and frightening. Overall, "Total Recall" is a must-see movie for anyone who enjoys thrilling and thought-provoking movies.

Based on the user's preference cues, I would recommend "Holes" by Thomas Sieben and Benjamin Braun.
The movie tells the story of a teenager named David who is forced to attend a summer camp run by a man named Gordon.
At first, David tries to resist and escape from the camp, but eventually he gives in to Gordon's manipulation and control over his life.
Throughout the movie, "Holes" explores various themes and ideas, such as the power of suggestion, the importance of self-reflection, the dangers of blind obedience, and the significance of personal growth and development.
Overall, "Holes" is a thought-provoking and engaging movie that explores various themes and ideas.

- Title: Shattered (1973))   | Plot: With the help of a sarcastic computer hacker Stevie Morris, two detectives, Veronica Heart and Jane Lyon engage in an impossible task of taking down a Russian crime boss lady who has the police department on her payroll and she has a unique way of taking out those who work against her. - Title: What Women Want (2000))   | Plot: A cocky, chauvinistic advertising executive magically acquires the ability to hear what women are thinking.
- Title: The Secret of My Success (N/ A))   | Plot: Fast climbing Arthur Tate rose to his fame, wealth and respectability quickly from a beginning as a naive constable His rise was also due to 3 women: dressmaker Violet Lawson, Lily, the Baroness von Lukenberg, and movie producer Marigold Marado, His rise was also due to Mrs. Tate, who always seemed to have an extra bit of information which would make her suggest to the people that her son Arthur be provided a position where he could do more good. Perhaps Mrs. Tate had a grander plan for herself.
- Title: The Monuments Men (2014))   | Plot: An unlikely World War II platoon is tasked to rescue art masterpieces from German thieves and return them to their owners.
